page.title: 13AMENITIES
page.content: There can be few parts of the industrialised south-east of England with as few amenities as this area. Although the village of Sulhamstead has a village hall, it has no shops, sporting facilities, churches or pubs. The church at Sulhamstead Bannister Upper End, which existed until recently, consists now of nothing more than the porch and a short section of the adjoining wall. Much of the graveyard is overgrown. The other church in the area is at Ufton Green. It too is nothing more than a single wall. The only public facility in the area is the Three Kings: Jack's Booth Public House. Many of its regular customers walk three miles or more to the pub. Most of the people who live in the area use the facilities along the A4 going into Reading for shopping and recreation.
